issue.title: Array field in PostgreSQL not compatible with ActiveField::checkboxList

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body: ### What steps will reproduce the problem? Create an array postgresql field. Try to use it with an ActiveForm widget checkboxList field. Field already has a value in database. ### What is the expected result? Form is correctly displayed and checboxes are correctly checked according to array values from database. ### What do you get instead? An exception is thrown when trying to open a form. ### Additional info The problem is that Html helper, when determening selected values, checks that $selection is an array or impelements Traversable, but ArrayExpression only implements ArrayAccess and Countable. So field's value is treated as a string and passed to strcmp(), which throws argument error. I think the best way would be to make ArrayExpression implement Iterable as well... | Q | A | ---------------- | --- | Yii version | 2.0.14? | PHP version | 7.0.27 | Operating system | Mac OS

body: @haohetao would you please help with the code to reproduce it?

when the postgresql table field is array,print the $selection is ArrayExpression.
$selection = array_map('strval', (array)$selection); trigger error
Would you please share some code for reproducing it and a stacktrace?

I fix the problem,change the line to 
$selection = array_map('strval', (array)$selection->getValue());

In my case the same error appears when I try to manipulate array field just after find a model by `ActiveQuery::one()`. At that moment an array field is instance of `ArrayExpression` and `(array) $model->array_field` (or other array functions) gets an error.
And, yes, only `getValue()` helps now.
My code:
`$companies = \array_unique($this->companies instanceof ArrayExpression ? $this->companies->getValue() : (array) $this->companies);`
